title: Chip Makers, Once in High Demand, Confront Sudden Challenges
description: Demand for semiconductors was off the charts last year. But a sharp slowdown coupled with new U.S. restrictions against China have created obstacles.
dc:creator: Don Clark
media:description: A Micron plant. U.S. chip makers have pledged huge expansions in domestic manufacturing, betting on a growing need for their products and the prospects of federal subsidies.
